name: RAIDERS
descriptionProjet: Based on the universe created by Daniel Friedman and CROM, Raiders allows you to embody Marken, a seasoned raider, traveling from town to town and dungeon to dungeon in search of treasures and perilous adventures! Raiders is a prototype of an action-adventure RPG game that skillfully blends elements of dungeon crawling and Hack 'n' Slash. In this game, players explore a medieval fantasy world filled with dungeons, monstrous creatures, and riches waiting to be unearthed. This project is divided into two distinct levels: the market, a tourist attraction, and the catacombs, a den of monsters and treasures. As a member of a two-person team, my mission was to design the catacombs level.
txt2: The Market :

Located at the top of a coastal highland region, this area quickly became a favorite destination for Raiders following the discovery of the catacombs. A thriving market has thus established itself here to attract adventurers in search of fortune. However, access to the dungeon is now controlled by the royal guards, forcing the daring to obtain a permit before entering. The challenge of this level is to obtain this permit in one of three possible ways. While exploring the market, players can also enjoy various attractions, participate in arena battles, check the wanted posters of criminals, or simply listen to the conversations of merchants. This level is full of interactions with NPCs who can assist the player in their quest and offer new opportunities for a well-deserved reward!
txt3: The Catacombs :

After exploring the market, players can enter the catacombs by passing through the hidden door in the massive stone sword at the tip of the peninsula. Named the Crypts of the Lover, these catacombs represent the underground passages of a fallen kingdom, brimming with treasures, traps, and now inhabited by terrifying creatures. The interior is immense, vast, and deep. Carved into a massive underwater cavern, light is scarce, obliging adventurers to equip themselves with light sources to avoid unpleasant surprises. Players must navigate through different levels and secret passages to discover the buried wealth. Raiders will traverse numerous rooms and face various challenges, including a banquet halll, a prison, a library, a crypt, and much more! The dungeon is also teeming with skeletal soldiers, once avid adventurers revived by an unknown force and compelled to protect the riches they once coveted.
txt4: Our primary source of inspiration for this game was, of course, the comic Raiders by Daniel Friedman and CROM. We also drew elements from games such as Skyrim, Dark Souls, and even Adventure Time to create our gameplay mechanics and environments. My primary inspiration for the catacombs level was the Mines of Moria from The Lord of the Rings, as I have always been fascinated by their grandeur and oppressive atmosphere. Additionally, I drew inspiration from the layout of Bloodborne's Chalice Dungeons to create a linear and interconnected level. Raiders remains one of my favorite projects to date. I thoroughly enjoyed designing the catacombs level and crafting a detailed environment that reflects the universe of our game! Despite the countless hours invested in this prototype, I experienced complete satisfaction, confirming my passion for level design.
txtPhotos1: Initial player position and entrance to the market. You can see 2 royal guards to symbolize their proximity to the dungeons and a sign with wanted posters.
Bridge and main path to access the market, with a view of the sea to show the location in the Highlands.
Near the main entrance, the player can already start interacting with various merchants and can also catch a glimpse of the enormous sword that conceals the entrance to the dungeon.
Central square of the market where all the merchants gather, with the giant hand's ring serving as a bridge to the dungeon. This symbolizes the dungeon named Crypt of the Lover.
On the right side of the market, the player can find the combat arena where they can demonstrate their strength against the Highlands fighters.
Right next to the arena, a crumbling ruin provides access to a small sanctuary.
The sanctuary represents one of the members of the royalty of the fallen kingdom who once used this place and the dungeon.

On the left coast of the market, the player can enter a building and find a small clandestine boat descent. On it, a strange character whose face appears on the wanted posters can help the player obtain a permit...
Following the main path, the player arrives at the entrance of the dungeon, protected by royal guards.
On the right coast, there is a boat descent used by maritime travelers to access the market.
txtPhotos2: Main entrance to the dungeon through the market gate. The player can already perceive that they are not the first due to the slightly open doors.
As you descend the stairs, you can start to perceive several lifeless silhouettes in the room.
Several skeletal remains can be found throughout the banquet hall, demonstrating a sinister past.
In addition to the skeletons, the room is increasingly falling into ruin, but a silhouette can be seen on the upper floor.
Just above the banquet table, the player can find a solitary feaster who holds the key to open the door leading to the rest of the dungeon.
Upon leaving the room, the player will have an overview of the multiple paths and stairs in the dungeon, as well as the grandeur and depth of the place.
Taking the first path, the player can spot another bridge and 3 accessible rooms from slightly below.
Upon reaching the first room, the player can see a roaming skeletal guard inside and a completely broken facade.
The presence of guards, cells, and torture tools indicates that this room served as a prison. A good place to find confiscated items.
Inside the cells, the player may perceive the remains of less fortunate adventurers...
Upon leaving the prison, the player will encounter other guards and notice 2 staircases along the path, one going up and the other going down.
By taking the descending staircase, the player must be agile and jump over the gap that separates the bridge and the room.
Once the agility test is successfully passed, the adventurer will find themselves inside a small library.
Lying partly on the table, the remains of a scribe protect a document indicating the presence of an alleged hidden treasure in the room.
The adventurer's path continues through the staircase leading to one of the pillars, on which you can see 3 other paths.
The first path leads to a very small room that should not be judged by its size.
As soon as the player enters the room, they realize they have just found one of the treasure-filled rooms with gold and jewels to take!
Back at the pillar, 2 more paths await the player.
By taking the left path, the player comes across a reception room flooded with poisoned water, but can spot a path made of wooden planks leading to the balconies.
On the left balcony, you can find a small armory guarded by a skeletal soldier, but also filled with new equipment!
On the right balcony, a tunnel opens up in front of the adventurer, perhaps the solution to the poison lies at the end.
Exiting the tunnel, the player emerges in a new room that appears to be a crypt for members of the royal family.
The room is indeed filled with plunderable sarcophagi, but also with guards and a strange object at the end of the room.
The player, upon opening the tombs, can find gold and jewels and also perceive certain symbols that could be related to the strange object.

Finally, once the player successfully lowers the water by solving the puzzle, they can enter the last room of the dungeon and face the boss, Patches, a familiar face that appeared everywhere on the wanted posters in the market!

name: The Moving Slaugh
descriptionProjet: The Moving Slough is a two-part project that distinguishes itself by its content while remaining closely interconnected. The first part of the project involves creating a semi-realistic universe set in 19th century Louisiana. In this world, a profound darkness reigns, populated by morbid creatures of all kinds. No one knows exactly why, but the epicenter of this darkness appears to emanate from a region erased from the maps: the Moving Slough, an extremely perilous territory that only the most daring hunters dare to explore. The second part of the project focuses on creating a game level that allows players to explore this swamp and uncover clues and traces of a bloody event.
txt2: Production :

The project spanned a period of 10 weeks, with 4 weeks dedicated to creating the universe and 6 weeks to designing the level itself. For the creation of the universe, I deliberately chose to focus on a small part of a potentially much larger world, teeming with unexplored ideas. This choice stems from my desire to create something specific, highlighting a unique location. This approach facilitated its representation as an exploratory level, where players can gather clues about the mysterious events that took place in this universe. For the level's design, I began the process by drawing a detailed map to ensure that all paths could be connected, with almost all leading to the center of the swamp. In the editor, the most crucial aspect of production was ensuring that the player was skillfully guided to the heart of the swamp, where most of the key elements are concentrated.
txt3: Challenges Faced :

This project presented several challenges, both in creating the universe and in designing the game level. The main challenge in creating the universe was to remain concise and stay within the boundaries I had set for myself, focusing mainly on the details of the marshy region. The primary challenges related to level design were associated with the use of Unreal Engine's terrain tool and ensuring that all paths were accessible and navigable. With limited experience with this tool, I had to go through numerous trial-and-error attempts to achieve the result I am proud of today. I also had to conduct numerous tests and research to create a dark and oppressive atmosphere while ensuring smooth navigation.
txt4: I drew a lot of inspiration from role-playing games such as We Deal in Lead, Deadlands, and Into the Wyrd and Wild for the creation of my universe, drawing from their types of creatures, locations, and themes. I also gathered many concepts and ideas from books like The Planet Construction Kit by Rosenfelder and Kobold Guide to Worldbuilding by Grubb. As for the level design, I drew extensive inspiration from swamp levels in games like The Witcher, Hunt: Showdown, and Weird West. My love for the western theme has always been a source of inspiration for me, and I am delighted to have had the opportunity to explore this genre and create my own altered universe.

As they advance, the player discovers the hunters' camp, with some items overturned and broken, suggesting that its occupants must have fled in haste. The scattered torches encourage the player to continue in that direction.
While continuing their journey, the player comes across a partially devoured horse, a sign that a deadly threat lurks nearby.
Upon reaching the bridge, the player glimpses the cabin at the heart of the swamp, as well as other sources of light indicating areas of interest to explore.
As they approach the cabin, one of these sources of light becomes clearer, revealing a silhouette standing near a tree.

Through one of the windows, the player can see one of the sources of light and discern a silhouette sprawled on the ground.
Upon exiting the cabin, the first source of light beckons the player.
Once on the scene, the player discovers the corpse of the second hunter, alongside their weapon, indicating that they fought to the end.
The other bridge, accessible from the cabin, guides the player to the second source of light.
After crossing this bridge, the player discovers the corpse of the third hunter, also dead next to their weapon.
In this swamp, where the lighting is low and thick fog obscures the view, the player cannot discern whether danger awaits them further...
The cabin, seen from a different angle, demonstrates that the sources of light remain visible despite the fog, serving as beacons to guide the player.

name: Space Scoundrel
descriptionProjet: Space Scoundrel is a third-person shooter game with an Action Roguelike style that puts players in the shoes of a treasure-seeking space pirate. The main goal of the player is to board enemy ships and plunder them for their precious loot. Players will explore procedurally generated ships where they will face a variety of enemies and have access to various weapons for defense.
txt2: Gameplay:

The player's mission is to make their way through the ship, fighting to survive until they reach the control room. Once there, they take control of the ship, marking the end of the game. If the player loses their life along the way, they will have to start from scratch in a brand new procedurally generated ship.
txt3: Production and Involvement:

This project was developed by a team of 2 people and spanned a period of 6 weeks. My main responsibilities in this project were designing the game systems and programming the dungeon generation system, weapons, character, and enemies. I implemented a dungeon generation system capable of taking prefab parts and creating a layout on a grid based on the desired size. I also developed a weapons system with various statistics, providing the player with a varied gaming experience depending on the weapon they choose to use.
txt4: The major challenge of this project lay in setting up the enemy system, as I had little experience with state machines. So, I had to conduct in-depth research to understand how they work. This part of the project was the most time-consuming, but I am satisfied with the result achieved for a first experience. I am particularly proud of the project, which represents my most ambitious achievement to date.

name: Petit Héros
descriptionProjet: Petit Héros is an action-adventure game heavily influenced by the EarthBound game series, both in its graphical style and narrative approach. In this game, players assume the role of a young hero who must save the world from the Dame en Noire, a demonic entity intent on taking over the Earth. This child also possesses the power to travel to a fantastical world to accomplish their quest, leading to a transformation of all elements in the real world.
txt2: Production and Involvement:

This project was developed in collaboration with a team of 6 people, spanning approximately 6 weeks. My primary responsibilities included creating all the tiles used to build the levels, designing enemies and their animations, as well as creating various decorative elements. I also took on the role of a level designer, which involved creating and integrating engaging levels in both the real and imaginary worlds.
txt3: Challenges and Difficulties:

The major challenge I faced in this project was level design. The imaginary world inherently appeared more attractive and intriguing to explore than the real world. Therefore, it was essential to make both worlds equally exciting by cleverly placing different interactions, non-player characters (NPCs), and objects in the levels to encourage players to explore both realms.
txt4: Our game was created in collaboration with Quebecois comedian Tommy Gaudet, a lover of the absurd, whimsical, and fantastical. We drew extensive inspiration from his quirky universe and sought to integrate his love for grandeur by creating an imaginary adventure that unfolds in the mind of the main character. Additionally, we drew inspiration from his favorite retro games, both in terms of aesthetics and gameplay, drawing from titles such as the EarthBound series and The Legend of Zelda.

name: Last Spark
descriptionProjet: Last Spark is an action, adventure, and survival game set in a sinister and oppressive atmosphere. The player takes on the role of the world's last hope, tasked with surviving long enough to overcome the lords of darkness and their sinister minions who roam freely in the environment. The solitary traveler must explore this devastated world in search of weapons and spells to support them in their desperate quest.
txt2: Production and Contribution:

This project was conceived and developed by a team of three people over a period of four months. My main responsibilities included game design, setting up systems, and programming, especially for the day/night cycle and the inventory and crafting system. My tasks encompassed creating gameplay mechanics and the game world, balancing and managing enemy waves that only appeared at night to ensure the player wasn't quickly overwhelmed, as well as integration into Unity. The majority of my work involved programming and managing the entire inventory and crafting system, including all the items the player could collect and use.
txt3: Challenges and Difficulties:

The most significant challenge in this project was properly balancing the damage of each weapon to prevent them from becoming either useless or too powerful. It was also necessary to find the right combinations for crafting recipes so that they were neither impossible to achieve nor too easy. Managing the drop rate and rarity of ingredients was also a major concern.
txt4: The final project was warmly received by our professors and peers, and it continues to be cited as an example in the course for current students. I feel immense pride in this project because it represents my first significant achievement, and it embodies a concept we had in mind since the beginning of our studies. Seeing it finally come to life held a special significance for me.

name: Escape the Nightwell Keep
descriptionProjet: Escape the Nightwell Keep is a captivating adventure and platform game prototype featuring a determined prisoner trying to escape from a haunted castle infested with skeletons and deadly traps. The player will need to find their way through this dark castle while collecting precious treasures on the way to the safe exit.
txt2: Production and Involvement:

I developed this prototype solo over a period of 3 weeks. My responsibilities included level design, programming game mechanics and enemies, as well as integrating them into the Unity development environment.
txt3: Challenges:

The most challenging aspect of this production was creating the level and programming the enemies. This project marked my first real experience with level design, and I wanted to create a map of a scale similar to what you find in Dead Cells. I took on a lot of responsibilities and had to start over several times to achieve a result that satisfied me while avoiding the level becoming too long and repetitive
txt4: My main sources of inspiration were primarily Dead Cells and Blasphemous, both in terms of level design, gameplay, and aesthetics. These games and their universes have been among my favorites for a long time, and I have always dreamed of creating my own interpretation, even though it presented a significant challenge for me!

name: Règne de Malheurs
descriptionProjet: Règne de Malheurs is a unique territory control game where players each embody a primary emotion that influences the actions of a medieval baron. The ultimate goal of the players is to become the dominant emotion, thereby dictating the tumultuous course of the baron's extravagant life.
txt2: Progression of a Game and Unique Features:

Emotions engage in fierce competition for control of the various cerebral regions of the baron by placing pieces each turn according to a specific order. This approach has various repercussions on other players and on the baron himself, due to the power associated with each conquered area. At the end of each turn, an event card is revealed by the designated player, and its impact on the game is determined by the leading emotion, adding to the absurd and comical adventures of noble life. The game concludes when the baron's life expires, and the final turn ends.
txt3: Production and Involvement:

My key role in creating this game was to design the rules system and work on the design and illustrations of the game board. This prototype was developed by a team of 4 people over a period of 8 weeks. One of our major challenges in designing the board was to accurately represent the real anatomy of the brain by placing the areas correctly and connecting them appropriately. It was also crucial to distribute points judiciously in different areas, awarding more points to challenging-to-control zones and fewer points to less strategic zones, such as those located in the corners of the board. Another key challenge during production was balancing the powers of different zones and event cards. Since the abilities of event cards are tied to the player's emotion revealing them, we had to ensure, after many playtesting sessions, that no emotion became too dominant compared to others.
txt4: Our main sources of inspiration for this game were the board games Risk and El Grande for their territory control mechanics, both of which are references in this field. Concerning the visual aspect, we drew inspiration from the quirky, dark, and twisted style of Tim Burton, as well as from the games Sleep Tight and Gloom for their unique atmosphere.

name: Repair 'n' Despair
descriptionProjet: Repair'N Despair is a captivating cooperative tabletop game where each player embodies a dedicated member of the crew of the STS Prometheus, a spaceship under attack by a terrifying extraterrestrial creature. The objective is clear: players must work as a team to repair the spacecraft and eliminate the extraterrestrial threat before it becomes unstoppable.
txt2: Major Innovation!

This game features a unique feature: the use of a mobile application is essential to play. This application not only times the allotted time for the crew members to complete their objectives but also adds a dose of stress by allowing the extraterrestrial creature to move randomly. At predefined intervals, an alarm sounds on the application, forcing players to interrupt their actions to move the creature following the instructions provided by the mobile app.
txt3: Commitment, Production, and Major Challenges:

My primary role in this project was designing the game rules in collaboration with other team members. I also programmed the mobile application and contributed to graphic design and the creation of the physical prototype. This prototype was developed by a team of 4 people over a period of 8 weeks.Our biggest challenge was finding a way to make the game faster and less repetitive than our initial ideas, which turned out to be too long and monotonous for players. That's why we decided to introduce the randomness mechanic via the mobile application, ensuring unique gameplay every time. Additionally, to eliminate monotony, we incorporated a mechanic where a player becomes the team leader each turn and assigns actions to other players, maintaining a dynamic pace, especially if a traitor is part of the game.
txt4: Our main sources of inspiration for this game were hidden identity games, where each player must complete various tasks to survive, such as Among Us or Unfortunate Spacemen, as well as movies like Alien for the theme. Visually, we drew inspiration from space depictions of the 1940s-50s and the graphic style of pulp science fiction.

name: John Kenn Mortensen
descriptionProjet: This creation represents my second motion design project. The goal of this project, with a dark and slightly frightening tone, was to explore the use of the puppet tool in After Effects to animate various objects and characters.
txt2: Production

This animation was created solo over a period of one month, primarily using the puppet tool to animate all elements of the project. It was my first experience with this tool, which required a significant time investment to cut out each element of the illustrations while preserving the smallest details and ensuring natural movement of the different parts. Additionally, this project provided me with the opportunity to deepen my knowledge of particle effects, fractal noise, and 3D creation within After Effects.
txt3: Inspiration

For a long time, I had the desire to create a work in this specific universe because I have always been fascinated by slightly horrific illustrations as well as horror and surrealism themes. That's why I chose to draw inspiration from the illustrations of John Kenn Mortensen, one of my favorite artists, in order to animate them with After Effects.

name: Tokyo
descriptionProjet: This small motion design project aimed to explore various tools and plugins in After Effects while incorporating luminous elements and shapes into the real world.
txt2: Production

Completed in just one month, this project primarily relied on a plugin called Thicc Stroke to create bright white lines. It also allowed me to deepen my understanding of using masks in the software to seamlessly integrate elements into the scene.
txt3: Inspiration

The inspiration for this project came to me from the opening sequence of the Japanese animation Sarazanmai. This sequence features two-dimensional characters moving within real images of Tokyo, with bright white lines and striking animations. I've always been captivated by this video because the music blends perfectly with the white light and the synchronization of animations, creating a soothing atmosphere. So, my desire was to create something similar.
